abilities.name: Holon Veil
abilities.text: Treat each Basic Pokémon and Evolution card in your deck, in your discard pile, in your hand, and in play as a Pokémon that has δ on its card.

attacks.name: Delta Circle
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Pokémon you have in play that has δ on its card.

abilities.name: Battle Aura
abilities.text: Each of your Pokémon that has δ on its card does 10 more damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Drag Off
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch.

abilities.name: Shining Horn
abilities.text: As long as Heracross is the only Pokémon you have in play, your opponent's Basic Pokémon can't attack.

attacks.name: Dig Deep
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for an Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand.

attacks.name: Extra Claws
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

abilities.name: Evolutionary Call
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Meganium from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may search your deck for up to 3 in any combination of Basic Pokémon or Evolution cards. Show them to your opponent and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Delta Reduction
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 30 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

abilities.name: Sharing
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at your opponent's hand. You may use the effect of a Supporter card you find there as the effect of this power. (The Supporter card remains in your opponent's hand.) You can't use more than 1 Sharing Poké-Power each turn. This power can't be used if Milotic is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Dark Horn
attacks.text: You may discard a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card from your hand. If you do, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and do 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Invitation
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Nidoqueen is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Vengeance
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Basic Pokémon and each Evolution card in your discard pile. You can't add more than 60 damage in this way.

abilities.name: Volunteer
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may remove 4 damage counters from Ninetales and discard Ninetales from Vulpix. If you do, search your deck for Ninetales or Ninetales ex and put it onto Vulpix (this counts as evolving Vulpix). Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Trick Tail
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for an Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon.

abilities.name: Armor
abilities.text: If your opponent has 5 of more cards in his or her hand, any damage done to Pinsir by attacks is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Delta Call
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon that has δ on its card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

abilities.name: Bedhead
abilities.text: As long as Snorlax remains Asleep between turns, put 2 damage counters on 1 of the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Delta Copy
attacks.text: Choose an attack on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon in play that has δ on its card. Delta Copy copies that attack except for its Energy cost. (You must still do anything else required for that attack.) Togetic performs that attack.

abilities.name: Shady Move
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Typhlosion is your Active Pokémon, you may move 1 damage counter from either player's Pokémon to another Pokémon (yours or your opponent's). This power can't be used if Typhlosion is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Burning Ball
attacks.text: If Typhlosion has at least 2 Fire Energy attached to it, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Burning Venom
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Strangle
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has δ on its card, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

abilities.name: Solid Shell
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done by your opponent's Pokémon to each of your Benched Pokémon that has δ on its card.

attacks.name: Grind
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Cloyster.

abilities.name: Delta Protection
abilities.text: Any damage done to Dewgong by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon that has δ on its card is reduced by 40 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Surge
attacks.text: If Dewgong has at least 2 Water Energy attached to it, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Sting Turn
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and switch Gligar with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Tail Sting
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

abilities.name: Stages of Evolution
abilities.text: As long as Jynx is an Evolved Pokémon, you pay Colorless less to retreat your Fire and Psychic Pokémon.

abilities.name: Prowl
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Ledian from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may search your deck for any 1 card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Metal Star
attacks.text: If Ledian has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Lap Up
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Delta Mind
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. If that Pokémon has δ on its card, put 3 damage counters instead.

abilities.name: Power Circulation
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your discard pile for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it on top of your deck. If you do, put 1 damage counter on Mantine. This power can't be used if Mantine is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from Mantine.

abilities.name: Dig Up
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Quagsire from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may search your discard pile for up to 2 Pokémon Tool cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand.

attacks.name: Pump Out
attacks.text: If Quagsire has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

abilities.name: Tropical Heal
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Tropius from your hand onto your Bench, you may remove all Special Conditions, Imprison markers, and Shock-wave markers from your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Grind
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the amount of Energy attached to Tropius.

abilities.name: Psychic Wing
abilities.text: If Vibrava has any Psychic Energy attached to it, the Retreat Cost for Vibrava is 0.

attacks.name: Quick Blow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

abilities.name: Extra Feather
abilities.text: Each of your Stage 2 Pokémon-ex does 10 more damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Scary Face
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack or retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Wrap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

abilities.name: Power of Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Electabuzz is an Evolved Pokémon, you may draw a card from the bottom of your deck. This power can't be used if Electabuzz is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Reverse Thrust
attacks.text: Switch Horsea with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Link Blast
attacks.text: If Kirlia and the Defending Pokémon have a different amount of Energy attached to them, this attack's base damage is 30 instead of 60.

attacks.name: Flickering Flames
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Nidorino.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Extra Ball
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Pokémon-ex, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Shelgon does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Flickering Tail
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

abilities.name: Extra Wing
abilities.text: The Retreat Cost for each of your Stage 2 Pokémon-ex is 0.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Swellow during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Charm
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Sonic Noise
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, that Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Granite Head
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Bagon by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Electabuzz from your hand onto Elekid (this counts as evolving Elekid) and remove all damage counters from Elekid.

attacks.name: Thunder Spear
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Feebas.

attacks.name: Sleepy Ball
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Paralyzing Gaze
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Tail Whip
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Poison Horn
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Psychic Boom
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the amount of Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Calm Mind
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Ralts.

attacks.name: Shell Grab
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Jynx from your hand onto Smoochum (this counts as evolving Smoochum) and remove all damage counters from Smoochum.

attacks.name: Alluring Kiss
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and basic Energy card, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Splash About
attacks.text: If Swablu has less Energy attached to it than the Defending Pokémon, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Totodile.

attacks.name: Quick Bind
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hypnotic Gaze
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

name: Buffer Piece
rules: Damage done to the Pokémon Buffer Piece is attached to by an opponent's attack is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). At the end of your opponent's turn after you played Buffer Piece, discard Buffer Piece.

name: Copycat
rules: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw a card for each card in your opponent's hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Holon Legacy
rules: Each Pokémon in play that has δ on its card (both yours and your opponent's) has no Weakness and can't use any Poké-Powers.
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

name: Holon Mentor
rules: Discard a card from your hand. If you can't discard a card from your hand, you can't play this card.Search your deck for up to 3 Basic Pokémon that each has 100 HP or less, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Island Hermit
rules: Choose up to 2 of your Prize cards and put them face up. (These cards remain face up for the rest of the game.) Draw 2 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Mr. Stone's Project
rules: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. Or, search your discard pile for up to 2 Basic cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Old Rod
rules: Flip 2 coins. If both are heads, put a Baby Pokémon, Basic Pokémon, or Evolution card from your discard pile into your hand. If both are tails, put a Trainer card from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Professor Elm's Training Method
rules: Search your deck for an Evolution card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Professor Oak's Research
rules: Shuffle your hand into your deck, then draw 5 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Strength Charm
rules: Whenever an attack from the Pokémon that Strength Charm is attached to does damage (after applying Weakness and Resistance), the attack does 10 more damage. At the end of your turn in which this happens, discard Strength Charm.

name: TV Reporter
rules: Draw 3 cards. Then, discard a card from your hand. If you have no cards in your deck, you can't play this card.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Switch
rules: Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

abilities.name: Extra Boost
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a basic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Stage 2 Pokémon-ex. This power can't be used if Altaria ex is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Healing Light
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Deafen
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Trainer cards (except for Supporter cards) from his or her hand during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Dragon Roar
attacks.text: Put 8 damage counters on the Defending Pokémon. If that Pokémon would be Knocked Out by this attack, put any damage counters not necessary to Knock Out the Defending Pokémon on your opponent's Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

abilities.name: Sand Damage
abilities.text: As long as Flygon ex is your Active Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Benched Basic Pokémon between turns. You can't use more than 1 Sand Damage Poké-Body between turns.

attacks.name: Psychic Pulse
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Imprison
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Gardevoir ex is your Active Pokémon, you may put an Imprison Marker on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Any Pokémon that has any Imprison markers on it can't use any Poké-Powers or Poké-Bodies. This power can't be used if Gardevoir ex is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Flame Ball
attacks.text: You may move a Fire Energy card attached to Gardevoir ex to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

abilities.name: Extra Smoke
abilities.text: Any damage done to your Stage 2 Pokémon-ex by your opponent's attacks is reduced by 10 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Energy Link
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for an Energy card and attach it to Kingdra ex.

attacks.name: Protective Swirl
attacks.text: Kingdra ex has no Weakness during your opponent's next turn.

abilities.name: Fellow Boost
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a basic Energy card from your hand to your Latias, Latias ex, Latios, or Latios ex. If you do, your turn ends. This power can't be used if Latias ex is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Power Crush
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Knocked Out by this attack, discard 2 Fire Energy attached to Latias ex.

abilities.name: Link Wing
abilities.text: The Retreat Cost for each of your Latias, Latias ex, Latios, and Latios ex is 0.

attacks.name: Ice Barrier
attacks.text: Prevent all effects of attack, including damage, done to Latios ex by your opponent's Pokémon-ex during your opponent's next turn.

abilities.name: Rage Aura
abilities.text: If you have more Prize cards left than your opponent, ignore all Colorless Energy necessary to use Rayquaza ex's Special Circuit and Sky-high Claws attacks.

attacks.name: Special Circuit
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to the Pokémon. If you choose a Pokémon that has any Poké-Powers or Poké-Bodies, this attack does 50 damage instead. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Type Shift
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this power. Salamence ex's type is Fire until the end of your turn.

attacks.name: Dual Stream
attacks.text: You may do up to 40 damage instead of 80 to the Defending Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Electromark
attacks.text: Put a Shock-wave marker on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hyper Claws
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Stage 2 Evolved Pokémon, this attack does 70 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Shock-wave
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon that has any Shock-wave markers on it. That Pokémon is Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Rotating Claws
attacks.text: You may discard an Energy card attached to Charizard Star. If you do, search your discard pile for an Energy card (excluding the one you discarded) and attach it to Charizard Star.

attacks.name: Dark Swirl
attacks.text: Discard all Energy cards attached to Charizard Star and discard the top 3 cards from your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Mimicry
attacks.text: Choose an attack on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon in play. Mimicry copies that attack. This attack does nothing if Mew Star doesn't have the Energy necessary to use that attack. (You must still do anything else required for that attack.) Mew Star performs that attack.

attacks.name: Rainbow Wave
attacks.text: Choose 1 basic Energy card attached to Mew Star. This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon that is the same type as the basic Energy card that you chose. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
